page.title: 08FARMING IN STEWARTON AREA
page.content: As dairy farms are predominant the most popular breed is Friesian or British Holstein with a very few pure Ayrshire or cross bred animals.Many farms have milking parlours and milk is collected by tankers and taken to Milk Marketing Board creameries. The farm buildings consist of the main farm dwelling house, usually white, and joined on to it housing for the cattle. Storage for feeding stuffs is usually in separate barns or sheds. Most farms are owner occupied and farmed by the farmer and helped by some of his family with few other farm workers. Farmers' daughters find employment in towns as do some of the sons now. Some of the upland farms have sheep and beef cattle which they rear for sale in Kilmarnock, Paisley, or Ayr markets.
